Jeremy Fairbank

Software Engineer. Tennessee. Making the web with JavaScript and Elm.

Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Instagram Github

About Me

Hi, my name is Jeremy Fairbank, and I am a software engineer. I enjoy working with JavaScript and Elm, but I know my way around other languages like Ruby. I like to build modular, component-driven applications with reasonable abstraction to keep things DRY. I really enjoy helping and teaching others, especially about JavaScript and Elm.

Work

I work for Sigient as a full-stack engineer with a focus on React, Redux, and functional programming.

Conferences

I like to speak at web development conferences. You can see many of my talks by visiting my conferences page.

Open Source

I have several open source projects and have contributed to the Backbone.js framework Marionette.js in the past.

  • revalidate: Elegant and composable validations for JavaScript.
  • redux-saga-test-plan: Powerful test helpers for Redux Saga.
  • redux-saga-router: A router for Redux Saga.
  • perchance: Simple maybe monad for JavaScript.
  • run-elm: Run Elm code from the command line.
  • chroma: Color manipulation gem for Ruby.
  • combos: Generate all possible permutations of an object's key-value pairs.

Please view my GitHub profile for more of my open source work.
